intro: Tankervillia cantoniensis, commonly known as the Guangdong tankervillia, is a flowering plant native to southern China. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, red berries that are edible. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
